newsitem.title: HONG KONG: SHK Prop sees steady property price rise.
newsitem.headline: SHK Prop sees steady property price rise.

text.p: Sun Hung Kai Properties Ltd said on Friday it expects residential property prices in Hong Kong to rise steadily, in line with inflation in the territory.
"We expect it (the price rise) to edge up steadily, following inflation closely," group chairman Walter Kwok said after the company's annual general meeting.
Kwok said Hong Kong property prices had risen about 30 percent this year.
He said property prices were expected to remain firm due to a continued shortage of supply in the coming year and strong underlying demand and buying power.
The September Consumer Price Index (A), Hong Kong's broadest measure of inflation, rose 5.2 percent on the year.
